result.execSummary:
The defendant Ron E Herron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ron E Herron

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Ron E Herron
Current: 7809 W BECKETT AVE, Colgate, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 06-03-2015)
Prior: 7825 West Fond Du Lac Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $660.00 entered as ordered by the court on 01/11/16 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 03/01/17. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered defendant to pay $100.00 fine PLUS all applicable court costs, disbursements and fees by June 7, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered DNA sample after today's proceedings.

-20 day appeal given,
 
Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Ron E Herron in court with attorney Randall Edward Paulson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Ron E Herron in court with attorney Randall Edward Paulson.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pre-trial conference. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31. All parties are notified that effective 12-1-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ron E Herron in court with attorney Randall Edward Paulson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case Case heard off the record.  State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requess a pretrial conference date.  Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant, Ron E Herron appeared in person PRO SE.  ADA Brittany Kachingwe appeared on behalf of the State.

Matter in court for status of counsel hearing.
Defendant has not yet retained private counsel.
Statements made.
Court APPOINTS Atty. Randall Paulson as counsel of record for the defendant at Milwaukee County rate of $75.00 per month.
Defendant is to repay Milwaukee County

Case adjourned to 10-20-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 37, Judge Dee's Court for Adjourned Status of Counsel.

Written order received and filed.

Defendant Ron E Herron in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant is not Public defender eligible. Defendant given additional time to retain private counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Ron E Herron in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Ron E Herron not in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 07-06-2015 at 01:30pm
